    • Method Detail

      • showPluginInputPanel

        void showPluginInputPanel(Plugin plugin)
        Shows input panel of the given plugin.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Plugin to show its input panel. null should be given for showing files sub-panel.

      • showPluginViewPanel

        void showPluginViewPanel(Plugin plugin)
        Shows view panel of the given plugin.
        Parameters:
        plugin - Plugin to show its view panel. null should be given for showing info sub-panel.

      • runProcessSequentially

        java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runProcessSequentially(PluginProcess process)
        Runs given process sequentially.
        Parameters:
        process - Process to be executed.
        Returns:
        Returns a Future representing that task. The Future's get method will return null upon successful completion.

      • runProcessInParallel

        java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runProcessInParallel(PluginProcess process)
        Runs given process in parallel execution mode.
        Parameters:
        process - Process to be executed in parallel mode.
        Returns:
        Returns a Future representing that task. The Future's get method will return null upon successful completion.

      • runProcessesSequentially

        void runProcessesSequentially(PluginProcess... processes)
        Runs given processes in sequential mode. Processes are executed in the given order.
        Parameters:
        processes - Processes to be executed in sequential mode.

      • runProcessSilently

        java.util.concurrent.Future<?> runProcessSilently(PluginProcess process,
                                                  boolean isSequential)
        Runs given process silently (i.e. no task submission notification will be shown). This method is useful to execute tasks directly from within other tasks (i.e. not from FX application thread).
        Parameters:
        process - Process to be executed.
        isSequential - True if task should be executed within the sequential task queue.
        Returns:
        Returns a Future representing that task. The Future's get method will return null upon successful completion.
